CatDescriptText: Mrs. Bernice Moore, 405 Rose Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 28, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "What do you think is wrong with the Pittsburgh Pirates? Do you think that they are using their best ball players at all times?" answer reads: I doubt if they do, but they should.  I should say that very seldom do they have a free hand."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bernice Moore wearing checkered pattern coat, standing in front of sign inscribed "pub...telepho...", left store window displaying candy on three tiered display, right store window displaying Goofy Balls with sign inscribed "vinyl inflated Goofy Ball 59 cents"
